Gracius:  Then by serving as an example to your enemies your life 
will not be lost in vain, but you will forever be a praised part of 
the Matrix.  But it is extremely rare stun beams would not suffice an 
unconcious opponent is of little more danger than a dead one, 
espicially locked away in your ships brige.  By then feeding and 
repairing him well he will see what is truely in his heart, because 
deep down it is the same as in your own (this guy has NOT met Shadow 
Star).

OOC: This sounds crazy to us, but these are mostly guys who have 
devoted themselves to the prosect of no more killing.  Although this 
would be a stupid faction if stun weapons at least weren't allowed.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> A large bot raised his hand. He was imposing, but his calm facial 
> expression showed no threat. He took a low, slow and peaceful tone.
> 
> Bot: I have one, leader Gracius. What if killing becomes 
unevitable, 
> so much that our very survival depends on it?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "dewboy30816" <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> > OOC: I decided to get the members of the Cybertronian Order of 
Monks 
> > straight we should a few posts out in space.  I doubt the poll of 
> who 
> > should land first will affect that.
> > 
> > BIC:  Gracius (P.S. thanks for the name rAuq) floats a few feet 
from

> > 
> > Gracius:  Remember my children we are the messengers of peace.  
> > Someday the Maximals and Predicons will have destroyed each 
other.  
> > We must teach our children the ways of Peace (assuming bots have 
it 
> > they have nothing against intercourse let alone girls joining up 
> they 
> > will make no destinction between Monk and Nun).  While fighting 
is 
> > neccessary in both bio and techno life killing is not.  That is 
why 
> > our code forbides the later, but not the former.  Do you have any 
> > questions my children (in other words if you have a char post him 
> > asking a question so I'll know he's there Pegatron's the only one 
I 
> > remember being on board for sure other than Gracius himself).

> > internal

managed 
> > to

had

> armory

righted

that 
> > had 
> > > walked onto his bridge giving a nod of respect to Hot Rod, it 
had

in

> > > say the thrusters are off line and quite frankly scrap. We need 
to

crashed

from

with

> > > law but at this point I don't give a slag what you've done. 
This

> > > is in bad shape, we have a mission to complete and I don't have

> > > to assign personnel to guard you in a brig."
> > > >

our 
> > > sensors up and running or report yourself to the CR chambers on

> > > two if you're too injured to help. But if you plan on sticking

> > > you're gonna help us, now get to it."
> > > >

Comm

comms 
> > > might be down, injuries to the CR chambers those not 
functioning, 
> > as 
> > > much as I hate to say it, we'll worry about later, priority on 
the 
> > > operational first."
> > > >

hoped 
> > > Megatron was as bad off as they were, if the predicons launched 
a

after 
> > the 
> > > crash. Moving to the computers he began investigating the 
status 
> of

> one

crew
